sentences.en: A company which is dissolute due a merger or division shall apply for cancellation of registration.
sentences.cn: 因合并、分立而解散的公司,应当申请注销登记.

sentences.en: After the disruption of the world, people who lost all love all live a dissolute life.
sentences.cn: 在世界经历过大灾难后, 人们失去了所爱,开始了放荡的生活.

sentences.en: He led a dissolute life after he made a lot of money in business.
sentences.cn: 自从他经商赚了许多钱后,生活变得腐化.

sentences.en: He who has no home is vagrant; He who has two homes is dissolute.
sentences.cn: 没家的男人是个流浪汉, 有两个家的男人是放浪者.

sentences.en: His dissolute life is inconsistent with his Puritan upbringing.
sentences.cn: 他的放荡生活和他的清教徒教养相悖.

sentences.en: I have also heard that he a dissolute lifestyle, but that is probably a nasty rumor.
sentences.cn: 我还听说他生活放荡不羁, 但这也许只是恶意的谣言.

sentences.en: I have also heard that he leads a dissolute lifestyle, but that is probably just a nasty rumor.
sentences.cn: 我还听说他生活放荡不羁，但这也许只是恶意的谣言。

sentences.en: I have also heard that he leads a dissolute lifestyle, that is probably a nasty rumor.
sentences.cn: 我还听说他生活放荡不羁, 但这只是恶意的谣言.

sentences.en: Jie was extremely tyrannical and dissolute.
sentences.cn: 桀是个极端残暴、放荡的人.

sentences.en: Nellie was married twice, the first time to a dissolute diplomat whose death left her a wealthy woman.
sentences.cn: 妮利结过两次婚，第一次嫁给了一个风流的外交官，外交官死后给他留下了大笔财富，使她成为一个有钱的女人。

sentences.en: The dissolute Presidential guard who deserted his post that fateful night was named John Parker.
sentences.cn: 在杀害林肯的那个灾难性的夜晚,放荡不羁的总统卫兵擅离职守,他名叫约翰·帕克.

sentences.en: When xylan extractives were desalted by ultrafiltration, optimum number of dissolute was 4.
sentences.cn: 木聚糖抽提液超滤脱盐时, 最经济的置换体积数为4.

sentences.en: You can't deny that Tom has been an idle, worthless, dissolute and dishonorable rogue.
sentences.cn: 你不能否认汤姆是个游手好闲 、 一钱不值 、 放荡无耻的坏蛋.

sentences.en: You can't deny that Tom has been an ilde, worthless, dissolute and dishonourable rogue.
sentences.cn: 你也不能否认汤姆是个游手好闲 、 一钱不值 、 放荡无耻的坏蛋吧.

words.tran_cn: 放荡地；荒淫地；毫无约束地

trans.tran_cn: 放荡的，淫乱的，猖，浪荡，风流
trans.tran_en: having an immoral way of life, for example drinking too much alcohol or having sex with many people
